action.action-desc: Mr. Meadows (for himself, Mr. Pittenger, Mr. Sessions, Mr. Collins of Georgia, and Mr. Stutzman) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To establish limitations, for fiscal years 2013, 2014, and 2015 on the total amount in awards or other discretionary monetary payments which may be paid to any Federal employee.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Common Sense in Compensation Act .

paragraph.text: the term discretionary monetary payment means—

subparagraph.text: any award or other monetary payment under chapter 45, or section 5753 or 5754, of title 5, United States Code; and

paragraph.text: the term covered compensation, as used with respect to an employee in connection with any period, means the sum of—

subparagraph.text: any discretionary monetary payments (excluding basic pay),

paragraph.continuation-text: payable to such employee during such period; and

paragraph.text: the term basic pay means basic pay for service as an employee.

section.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, no discretionary monetary payment may be made to an employee—

paragraph.text: during the period beginning on the date of the enactment of this Act and ending as of the close of fiscal year 2013; or

during fiscal year 2014 or 2015, to the extent that such payment would cause the total covered compensation of such employee for such fiscal year to exceed 105 percent of the total amount of basic pay payable to such individual (before the application of any step-increase in such fiscal year under section 5336 of title 5, United States Code) for such fiscal year.

section.text: The Office of Personnel Management may prescribe regulations to carry out this Act.
